fields.title: Re-evalulate Servlet3 and DI
fields.body:
As part of the massive 1.4.0 refactor, I introduced [Dagger](http://square.github.io/dagger) for DI and updated to *Servlet3* which allowed me to eliminate almost everything in *web.xml*.

This worked great... until you ran Gitblit in a JEE container with CDI.  Gitblit would fail to load properly because the container's dependency injector was intercepting all `@Inject` references thus not allowing Dagger to do it's job.  This was bad and I couldn't figure out how to stop the container from *helping* so I rolled-back to Servlet 2.4 in 65d5bb3f1cbfb42be5a3c4aa077b7ab2504082af and eliminated all JSR-330 annotations but retained Dagger in a reduced capacity.

I want to take another stab at this (Dagger pun intended).  I've stumbled across [this short page](http://docs.oracle.com/javaee/6/tutorial/doc/gjbnz.html) which may make Dagger DI using JSR-330 annotations work properly in a JEE container.  More details about *beans.xml* are available [here](http://www.seamframework.org/124139.lace).

A switch to Guice is also a possibility, although I need to understand the limitations of Dagger (and the presumed benefits of Guice) before making that jump.
